intro: Pycreus fasciculatus, commonly known as the clustered pycreus, is a species of flowering plant native to the western regions of the United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies due to its adaptation to arid environments.
